Key Match Events: The Hornets missed their first four shots off the frame and turned the ball over three times (equaling their first-quarter total), leading to six points for Cleveland on a 13-2 run that pushed the lead to 42-25.

Charlotte connected on just 1-of-11 (9.1 percent) from the field and 1-of-7 (14.3 percent) from long range as the Cavs build their largest lead of the game, 53-29, at the 5:00 mark of the second quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller returned to the Hornets lineup after missing three games with their respective injuries, giving Charlotte its projecting starting five to start the season for just the third time in 2024-25.
Both Ball (left ankle, right wrist) and Miller (left ankle) showed little rust to start the contest and continued to fight throughout.
Miles Bridges (23.3 points, 10.3 rebounds) and Mark Williams (16.7 points, 10.3 rebounds) both averaged double-doubles in Ball and Miller’s absence the past three games.
Post-Match Reflections: I thought that we started a little slow, and when you're coming on the road and playing a good team like that, they definitely make you pay for every mistake you make... But we're fighting, we're competing, we're trying to find ways of having better offensive possessions so that it doesn't continue to put as much pressure on our defense

He took full advantage of his opportunity to play today. It's just a testament to Nick continuing to put in the work with our Greensboro staff. He got some real, high-quality games there. They worked on the things that he needed to work on, and today he came out, hooped and balled and gave us the lift that we needed
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nick Smith Jr. saw action in his second-straight game to start the New Year and scored a season-high 18 points on 7-of-12 shooting from the field and 4-of-6 shooting from outside the arc.
Smith also filled the stat sheet with five rebounds, two assists and a blocked shot in 20 minutes off the bench.
Miles Bridges (23.3 points, 10.3 rebounds) and Mark Williams (16.7 points, 10.3 rebounds) both averaged double-doubles in Ball and Miller’s absence the past three games.
